blocks.text: The City of Toronto Budget Process
Like any budget process, the City budget process involves deliberation, estimation, measurement, and evaluation.

Toronto's budget process is mostly internal. The public portion is more about compliance than collaboration. Here is a rough timeline of the entire cycle, spanning about 27 months. The active public budget events are concentrated on the directions budget committee meeting in May, and an adoption process the following winter.

For more information see the City of Toronto website, and our Budget Roadmap section. The 2016 section of our budget roadmap has a set of about 50 budget decision points that were collected by a volunteer through interviews and public records at the time. Since then the budget process has become even more closed.
